===Etymology===
Derived from {{etyl|ko|ja|sort=めんたいこ}} {{m|ko|명태||[[Alaska pollock]]} or {{vern|walleye pollock}}}} (formerly spelled with the [[hanja]] {{l|ko|明太}}) + Japanese {{m|ja|子|tr=ko||[[child]]; [[roe]]}}.

===Pronunciation===
{{ja-pron|yomi=irreg|めんたいこ|acc=0|acc_ref=DJR|acc2=3|acc2_ref=DJR}}

===Noun===
{{ja-noun|めんたいこ}}

# the [[marinated]] [[roe]] of {{taxlink|Theragra chalcogramma|species|noshow=1}}, the [[Alaska pollock]] or {{vern|walleye pollock}}
#: A common ingredient in Japanese [[cuisine]]. Originated from {{m|ko|명란젓}} Korean cuisine<ref>[http://news.nate.com/view/20101214n26574 일본 후쿠오카에서 한식세계화 가능성을 엿보다]</ref>, introduced to Japan after the Russo-Japanese War. The typical [[seasoning]] and [[flavor]] is slightly different in Japan.

====Derived terms====
* {{ja-r|辛子明太子|からし めんたいこ}}: spicy ''mentaiko'', [[salted]] and [[aged]]
